page.title: 03 ABERDULAIS WATERFALL.
page.content: In our area we have the{Aberdulais {Waterfall.}People long,long ago used the water to turn a waterwheel to get power to smelt Copper and Iron. It was smelted in a building near the waterfall.You can see the ruins today, and{The National Trust}are trying to restore things.They came in{1981} and have about 5 people working there at the moment. The falls have been used for Copper smelting,Corn-milling,Tin- plate manufacture and also as a Iron forge.They were first used in{1584} when they used Charcoal and Coal from the mountain. The falls were formed by a glacier cutting the ground away,which made a valley so that the{River Dulais fell into the Neath valley.The falls are ten and a half metres tall.
